glosses: Creates participles and relative clauses where
the relativized element is the grammatical subject of the clause

examples.translation: a product which is sold here

glosses: Creates participles and relative clauses where
the relativized element is the possessor of the grammatical subject of the clause

examples.translation: a man whose hat is backwards

glosses: Creates participles and relative clauses where
the relativized element is the possessor of some other element of the clause, and the subject is categorial and indefinite

examples.translation: a villager whose sheep were caught by wolves
a child who has a hat on their head

glosses: Creates nouns with the meaning of "the one who ...", "those who ...", "those which ..." etc. when one of the aforementioned conditions apply

examples.translation: those who are disembarking the train

glosses: Combines with the dative suffix and the postpositions kadar, dek or değin to mean until

etymology: From Ottoman Turkish ـان (-an), from Old Anatolian Turkish [Term?], from Proto-Turkic *-gan.
